## Get Data

```{r}
# Get highway data from OSM

queryB <- getbb("Leuven, Belgium") %>% 
   opq() %>% 
   add_osm_feature("building") %>% 
   osmdata_sf()

leuBuildings <- queryB$osm_polygons

```

```{r}
# Load data from GHSL

belGHSL <- raster(here::here("2021/data/rawData/GHS_POP_E1975_GLOBE_R2019A_54009_250_V1_0_18_3/GHS_POP_E1975_GLOBE_R2019A_54009_250_V1_0_18_3.tif"))
```

## Wrangle Data

```{r}
# Clean data

leuBuildings <- leuBuildings %>% 
  select(osm_id, highway, geometry) %>% 
  st_transform(3857)
```

```{r}
# Now, I want a minimum bounding box

leuBound <- leuBuildings %>% 
  st_bbox() %>% 
  st_as_sfc()

mapBound <- leuBound %>% 
  st_centroid() %>% 
  st_buffer(4000,
            endCapStyle = "SQUARE")

mapLimit <- leuBound %>% 
  st_centroid() %>% 
  st_buffer(4500,
            endCapStyle = "SQUARE")

```

```{r}
# Clip data to this area

leuBuildingsFilter <- leuBuildings %>% 
  st_intersection(mapBound)

```

```{r}
# Extract data for this area

leuPopulation <- exact_extract(belGHSL, 
                        leuBuildingsFilter,
                        'sum',
                        progress = F)

# Join the data back to the grid

leuBuildingsFilter$population <- leuPopulation

mean(leuBuildingsFilter$population)

median(leuBuildingsFilter$population)

min(leuBuildingsFilter$population)

max(leuBuildingsFilter$population)

leuBuildingsFilter %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = population)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  xlim(c(0, 5))
```

## Build Map

```{r}
# Build the base layer

vizBase <- tm_shape(mapLimit) +
  tm_fill(col = "#f1eee9") +
  tm_shape(mapBound) +
  tm_fill(col = "#f1eee9") +
  tm_borders(col = "#f1eee9",
             lwd = 1) +
  tm_layout(bg.color = "#f1eee9",
            frame = F,
            frame.lwd = NA,
            attr.outside = F,
            outer.margins = 0,
            asp = 0,
            scale = 0.8,
            main.title = "Population in 1975*",
            main.title.color = "#000000",
            main.title.size = 1.75,
            main.title.fontfamily = "Arial Narrow",
            main.title.fontface = 2,
            main.title.position = "center",
            title = "Leuven",
            title.color = "#000000",
            title.size = 1.25,
            title.position = c("center", "TOP"),
            title.fontface = 2,
            legend.position = c("right", "top"),
            legend.title.color = "#f1eee9",
            legend.text.color = "#000000",
            legend.height = -0.1) + 
  tm_credits("#30DayMapChallenge | Day 24 | Anirudh Govind | Nov 2021 | Map data Â© OpenStreetMap contributors and available from https://www.openstreetmap.org\nSchiavina, Marcello; Freire, Sergio; MacManus, Kytt (2019): GHS population grid multitemporal (1975, 1990, 2000, 2015) R2019A.\nEuropean Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC) DOI: 10.2905/42E8BE89-54FF-464E-BE7B-BF9E64DA5218 PID: http://data.europa.eu/89h/0c6b9751-a71f-4062-830b-43c9f432370f",
             col = "#000000",
             size = 0.75,
             position = c("left", "bottom"),
             fontfamily = "Arial Narrow")
```

```{r}
# Build the other layers

myPalette <-  c("#fc9272",
               "#fb6a4a",
               "#ef3b2c",
               "#cb181d",
               "#a50f15",
               "#67000d")

vizPop <- tm_shape(leuBuildingsFilter) +
  tm_fill(col = "population",
          palette = myPalette,
          legend.show = T,
          breaks = c(0,
                     3,
                     6,
                     9,
                     12,
                     15,
                     Inf)) +
  tm_borders(col = "#000000",
             lwd = 0.01)

```

```{r}
# Put layers together

viz <- vizBase +
  vizPop
```

## Export

```{r}
# Export the map as an image to upload onto twitter

tmap_save(tm = viz,
          filename = here::here("2021/exports/Day24.png"),
          dpi = 450,
          width = 200,
          height = 200,
          units = "mm")

```
